title: Assessing and Managing Water Use and Discharges From Aquaculture Facilities

tasks.task: Understanding and managing aquaculture systems, including fish species, water treatment, and waste management.
subtasks: Identifying various aquatic species for culture, such as Atlantic salmon, Arctic char, rainbow trout, walleye, saugee, tilapia, and shrimp.
Recognizing the difference between coldwater, coolwater, and warmwater fish species and their suitable environments.
Understanding the role of water temperature in fish growth and oxygen consumption.
Learning about water quality parameters, especially dissolved oxygen levels, and their management techniques.
Grasping the concept of wastewater treatment in aquaculture, including solids removal and ammonia-nitrate conversion.
Applying management practices for recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS) and flow-through systems.
Considering the impact of phosphorus on aquatic environments and its regulation.
Adapting aquaculture practices based on geographic location (e.g., northern vs. southern states).
